Package javelin.controller.map.terrain.water

Class Shore

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.controller.map.Map
      • javelin.controller.map.terrain.water.Shore
  • public class Shore
extends Map
    Map to be used in a Water tile that meets some type of non-water terrain adjacent to it. DeepWaters aren't particularly interesting or fun so we leave that full-flooded approach to where it makes the most sense in the game World. No effort is put into determining which side the shore(s) should be from at this point in time - especially considering this might be used from a Minigame or similar and not a proper World map. Players are left to imagine that the NSWE positions of the BattleScreen aren't necessarily aligned with that of the WorldScreen. Having some sort of seeded map generation here so that approaching the same tile from the same angle would always result in the same map would be interesting, but not particularly desirable or urgent - especially considering Javelin has a larger World scale than almost any other game, meaning there's plenty of opportunity to access an area from the same angle and still end up in a different internal region of that tile-crossing.
    Author:
    alex
